content: This is an update to several threads that ran on this forum last year ... quote: RALEIGH, N.C. — A Marine accused of killing a pregnant colleague in North Carolina and fleeing to Mexico will be returned to the U.S. this week, federal authorities said Thursday. Cpl. Cesar Laurean, 22, was scheduled to be extradited Friday and processed in a Texas court. Further details of his arrival weren't disclosed because of safety concerns, said FBI spokeswoman Amy Thoreson. Laurean was charged with first-degree murder after the charred remains of Lance Cpl. Maria Lauterbach, 20, were found in January 2008 buried in his backyard in Jacksonville. Lauterbach, of Vandalia, Ohio, had been eight months pregnant. <more> "http://www.foxnews.com/story/0,2933,516581,00.html" "The mills of justice grind slow, but they grind exceeding small ... " This message has been edited. Last edited by: I_M_Qwerty, Thu 16 April 2009 09:55 PM

content: It's about time. Although I'm sure his time as an American in a Mexican prison wasn't all that great. What a P.O.S. He's the guy that got a girl pregnant, than cut her up, burned her body, then ran to Mexico. Scum of the Earth. Rot in hell, you scumbag.

content: Hi, my name is Catherine and I plan to join the military. The thing I have to say is this is what he did is wrong and sad. I think he killed her to keep her from testifying against him and to keep his wife from finding out. He should be put away for a long time. Sincerely Catherine Powell

content: The Onslow County DA had to cut a deal with Mexico and agree not to seek the death penalty in order to obtain extradition. Befor the Marine's sack this turd, they may want to convien a GCM and provide the sentence the State of NC would like. After all the Marine's never cut a deal with Mexico, and an active duty marine still falls under the UCMJ. I believe 2 counts of murder, along with UA/desertion in a time of war still rates the death penalty.
